name: NPR
text:
The NFL has announced that the song "Lift Every Voice and Sing," known as the Black national anthem, will be performed live or played at the start of every season-opener game.
https://t.co/F8ZUfC7RlK

name: NPR
text:
A massive landslide at a jade mine in Myanmar has killed at least 162 people. A dramatic video captured the wall of earth sliding down a mountainside into a water-filled pit.
https://t.co/96gK1KFC7X

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Tammy Duckworth says she intends to block the pending promotions of more than 1,000 Army officers until Defense Secretary Mark Esper confirms he has not blocked and will not block the promotion of impeachment witness Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman.
https://t.co/DK5f5R218y

name: NPR
text:
The Atlanta Hawks, the Detroit Pistons and the Milwaukee Bucks have offered up their facilities to serve as voting sites amid the pandemic.

The teams have also outlined efforts to try to boost voter awareness and participation. 
https://t.co/qEMQ4ICV90

name: NPR
text:
President Trump has now confirmed 200 federal judges, each of which can serve a life term.

By one count, nearly 7 in 10 of those judges are white men, there's only one Latina appeals court judge Latina ‚Äî and no Black appellate judges.

text:
A Black Facebook employee is accusing his employer of racial discrimination by failing to give Black workers equal opportunities in their careers and creating a "hostile work environment." 

His complaint echoes longstanding criticism of the company.

text:

"We ended up doing seven," he says.

name: NPR
text:

Plaintiffs wanted the rules suspended during the pandemic, which is still peaking in Alabama. https://t.co/6dBwxumzRP
